PIVOTAL FIELD OPERATIONS A Message from Greg Stroud JULY 2014 SALES NEWS FLASH Global Field Operations Team,
As we enter 2HFY14, please take the time to read the communication carefully; as there are a number of policy, process, and pricing changes that you should be aware of.
Pivotal’s New Domain Extension – Notify Your Customers with this Customizable Email Template
On Monday morning (PST) 28 July, Pivotal will publicly launch a new domain extension, www.pivotal.io <http://www.pivotal.io/>. The new “.io” domain will replace our existing “gopivotal” e-mail addresses, websites, and other social properties. As part of this, all Pivotal Labs e-mail addresses will now become become: “username@pivotal.io” Take note that the Pivotal Labs (www.pivotallabs.com) and Pivotal Tracker (http://www.pivotaltracker.com <http://www.pivotaltracker.com/>) websites and social properties will not change.
To notify your customers/opportunity contacts of your new email and the new “.io” domain, we have created customizable email templates, available on the links below. For more information on .io, please visit the Pivotal IT Support page <https://sites.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/pivotal-it/?pli=1> and the FAQ <https://sites.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/inside-pivotal/pivotal-io> available on Inside Pivotal.As a best practice, please add your new .io email to your email signature and out-of-office responses as well.
Non-Labs Customer Template <https://docs.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/document/d/1rAO1SsUux3AX-mhJECGYcglld4k4gzCgL1mPPBeHXN0/edit?usp=sharing> Labs Customers Template <https://docs.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/document/d/19KXQwiQJw856o9P5-t1x9EDPhwo8GLGcNsumucM0IaA/edit?usp=sharing>
Pivotal Services Defined!
Confused about Services? CSO and Services are demystified here <https://docs.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AruO4XIa64ANdGVNUW00d2F0NWZ0TGhzTGJrSkFkNFE&usp=drive_web#gid=15>. Labs SKUs have also been added to the Q3 Product & Services Availability Sheet. Click on the second tab, Services SKUs <https://docs.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AruO4XIa64ANdGVNUW00d2F0NWZ0TGhzTGJrSkFkNFE&usp=drive_web#gid=15> for the complete list.
Global Support Services
Are you or your customers having questions on how to engage support? If so, please take a look at the newly created Addressing Pivotal Support Questions <https://docs.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/document/d/1sy2eC1hzQpw-gpjqKVvA4stzel8O7cwWrx_SVvFynNw/edit>. Feel free to contact the Customer Service team directly at Customer-Service@gopviotal.com <mailto:Customer-Service@gopviotal.com>. The team can provide you or your customer a “Pivotal Support Introduction.” This is a quick conversation to introduce the Customer Service Team and How to Register and Access Pivotal Support as well as address any open questions on engaging support.
Q3 Field Accreditation
As you saw in Scott’s note, all 9 courses are to be completed by August 8th. Log into Pivotal Academy <http://pivotal.biglms.com/?mkt_tok=3RkMMJWWfF9wsRokvqrBZKXonjHpfsX97OkoWqa1lMI%2F0ER3fOvrPUfGjI4CRMZnI%2BSLDwEYGJlv6SgFTLLAMal10LgNWxg%3D> and click on “Field Enablement” to get started. We’re expected to see 100% Field completion. Make it happen!
Compensation New PCF SPIF. From July 1st through December 31st all Reps and FE individual contributors are eligible to both receive $7,500 USD on each new 1, 2 or 3 year PCF Subscription customer booking >$250K per unique customer order. The SPIF will be paid after the fiscal year close. Please read the FAQs here <https://drive.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/file/d/0B7uO4XIa64ANMlIwVTBJMjJ0VFE/edit?usp=sharing>.
PS@E and DCA SPIF have been renewed for 2H FY14. The same requirements will continue for the remainder of the year. Please reference the Pivotal Compensation Deck <https://drive.google.com/a/gopivotal.com/file/d/0B7uO4XIa64ANVmd3VHdicnJuQlE/edit?usp=sharing> on Inside Pivotal for further detail.
Questions? Please send to Sales-Commissions@gopivotal.com <mailto:Sales-Commissions@gopivotal.com>.
SFDC What’s New
SFDC Single Sign-On is nearly here! Next week, you may leverage your Okta credentials to access SFDC, meaning no more passwords! Starting next week, you may access Single Sign-On by following the steps below. Stay tuned for additional announcements via Chatter.
Single Sign-On (PC)
Step 1: Navigate to pivotal.my.salesforce.com Step 2: In the next screen, click Log in via Okta and you will be redirected to your Okta login page Step 3: Enter in your Pivotal Okta credentials along with authentication code
You will now have SSO on your desktop on your PC! You may also access from your Okta main page/application menu.
Single Sign-On (Mobile) Step 1. Ensure Salesforce1 is installed on your device Step 2. From the app login screen, click on Log into Custom Domain Step 3. In the Enter Custom Domain box, type in Pivotal Step 4. In the next screen, click Log in via Okta and you will be redirected to your Okta login page Step 5: Enter in your Pivotal Okta credentials along with authentication code Step 6. Click allow
You will now have SSO on your desktop and mobile device!
New Way to Submit a SFDC Request Have a new hire that needs access to SFDC or a request to add something new to SFDC? Now you can make these types of requests directly within SFDC using the “New Request” tab at the top of your SFDC home screen. Instruction, list of request types, and FAQ is available on Inside Pivotal under SFDC Resources: Creating a New Request in SFDC.
Reference Edge – Your SFDC Reference System is nearly here!
We will soon be introducing a native SFDC reference system that will enable you to find references from the opportunity management environment you're all familiar with. This new reference system will not only make it easier for you to find references, but share externally approved customer success examples with your customers. Oh, and there will also be incentives to fulfill reference requests, such as Bose Noise Canceling headphones and an iPad Air. Stay tuned for more details!
Make it happen!
Greg
